Comments
Always have officers or security around, it makes me feel truly safe!
Always have things going on and always different! Lots of variety.
This is great for beginner students that are new to big schools or colleges.
The campus (red mountain) is literally in the desert! It makes learning about the wildlife and desert foliage fun and interesting since it's all on campus!
I have had a great experience and it's pretty inexpensive since it's not an university!
They always have events planned for several occasions, also there are endless amounts of clubs to join!
The cafe is really good and fairly priced!
The students are very friendly
This always varies according to the teacher but, all my classes have been fairly easy or easily manageable.
Don't be afraid to ask questions! Everyone (teachers and office staff) are there to help you!
I love Mesa Community College! It is a very relaxed atmosphere but at the same time, the quality of learning is excellent!
pageTitle: Mesa Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {585256=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 44349=Over the past year, MCC has been expanding it's food and dining experience. Back in 2011, the lunch room was very modest, and pretty dull to be honest. The new updated 2012 room is more of a lounge or really large cafe. The food selection has grown, there are many tables, couches and chairs to lounge around on, plenty of vending machines, and an overall more relaxed environment, though it may become a bit loud a times. The food pricing is typical for any college; overpriced. In the end, I must applaud MCC for stepping their game up on this aspect., 409901=This is the place to decide what you want to do for the rest of your life. Take all the basic courses and figure out what subjects you enjoy the most. If you end up changing you're career then you only have to pay $1200 more instead of $12000 at most universities.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Diondre from Mesa, AZ 12/23/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 3 of 148 Categories Comments Great for these types of students I think it's great for every type of student out there. There is something for everyone. Tips for prospective students Make sure to choose your teacher wisely because like at every institution there are teachers who enjoy teaching and there are teachers who could care less. Bang for the buck MCC is one of the cheaper colleges to attend but I don't think you get what you pay for...I think you get more. The curriculum is a little higher than what you expect going into a community college. The teacher there seem to want to give you their knowledge so you can become as fascinated in the subject as they are. Am enjoying being here
